titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry Records
Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 10:04

did.unittitle: Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of minutes, annual reports, articles, grant proposals and reports, and financial statements documenting the operations of the Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 37 (YRG 37), Records of associations, institutes, centers, and organizations affiliated with Yale University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry, 1981-1986.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry Records (RU 484). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged as follows: Series I. Minutes of the Board of Directors and Fellowship Committee. Series II. Annual Reports. Series III. Reprints of Publications Reporting Research Supported by Foundations' Fund. Series IV. Reprints of Publications Reporting Research Supported by Ford Foundation Training and Block Grants. Series V. Final Grant Reports; and subsequent accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry (FFRP) was established in 1953 by the Social Research Foundation. Yale Corporation served as trustee and custodian. The purpose of the FFRP was to to support research in psychiatry through a grant program. The FFRP ceased operations in 1981.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of minutes, annual reports, articles, grant proposals and reports, and financial statements documenting the operations of the Foundations' Fund for Research in Psychiatry.
